iati-activity.title: IMPROVEMENT OF THE BASIC SERVICES
iati-activity.description: TO IMPROVE EDUCATION AND BASIC HEALTH CARE IN SOOL AND SANAAG REGIONS

iati-activity.title: INCOME GENERATING FOR WOMEN
iati-activity.description: TO DEVELOP INCOME GENERATING ACTIVITIES FOR WOMEN LIVING IN MOGADISHU

iati-activity.title: SIDICIYO CHARITY - SCHOOL
iati-activity.description: BASIC EDUCATION AS WELL AS EDUCATION ON HEALTH CARE, CIRCUMCISION, FOR PUPILS AND THEIR PARENTS.

iati-activity.title: EDUCATION DEVELOPMENT
iati-activity.description: DEVELOPING SCHOOLING AND OTHER BASIC SERVICES.

iati-activity.title: YOUTH VOCATIONAL WORKSHOPS
iati-activity.description: IMPROVING SAFETY AND DEMOCRACY BY PROVIDING VOCATIONAL TRAINING FOR JUVENILES.

iati-activity.title: CAPACITY BUILDING FOR TUBERCULOSIS DIAGNOSTICS IN MOGADISHU
iati-activity.description: PILOT PROJECT: TRAINING SUPPORT AND CAPACITY BUILDING FOR TUBERCULOSIS DIAGNOSTICS AND PREPARING THE ESTABLISHING OF TUBERCULOSIS REFERENCE LABORATORY IN MOGADISHU, SOMALIA.

iati-activity.title: HUMANITARIAN AID THROUGH FINNISH RED CROSS AND ICRC
iati-activity.description: RELIEF AID IN A FAILED STATE SITUATION.

iati-activity.title: NGO SUPPORT / ADULT EDUCATION SUPPORT
iati-activity.description: THE PROJECT AIMS TO FIGHT ILLITERACY BY TEACHING READING AND WRITING SKILLS TO 50 MEN AND 50 WOMEN ANNUALLY. AFTER BASIC LITERACY, ENGLISH, SOMALI AND MATHEMATICS WILL BE TAUGHT.
iati-activity.sector: Basic life skills for youth and adults

iati-activity.title: FRAME AGREEMENT WITH NGO (INT.SOLIDARY FOUNDATION)
iati-activity.description: MICRO CREDIT INSTITUTION SUPPORT IN NORTHERN SOMALIA. THE PURPOSE OF THE PROJECT IS THE REDUCTION OF THE ECONOMICAL VULNERABILITY AND STRENGTHENED SELF-RELIANCE CAPACITY OF 150 RETURNED WOMEN REFUGEES AND/OR WIDOWS THROUGH MICRO-CREDITS AND BUSINESS MANAG

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Int.Solidary Foundation)
iati-activity.description: Strengthening the Capacity and Sustainability of Adult Education Centres in Burao_ Northern Somalia. The purpose of the project is strengthened capacity of vocational school in Burao_ Somaliland in order to provide quality vocational training for young w

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Int.Solidary Foundation)
iati-activity.description: Community education project on FGM/AIDS in Somaliland. The purpose of the project is to eradicate female genital mutilation (FGM/FGC) in Burao_ Somaliland.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / NASIB, Information and media training for women in Somalia
iati-activity.description: Teaching basic media skills to poor women in Mogadishu, Somalia to increase inrofmation on nutrition, health, reproductive health and human rights issues. After basic training women may specialize to one form of media (radio, visual or paper media). Also basic literacy skills will be taught.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Godinlabe Primary school project
iati-activity.description: The state of schools in Godinlabe, Galgadud is miserable, in 16 years the schools have been totally neglected and the school houses have deteriorated. Not one public school is functioning at the moment and the children of poor families are out of education services. During the first year the project will repair 6 classrooms. Two seminars will be organized, one on curriculum development and the other for parents on the importance of education. Four teachers will be recruited. The second year another six classrooms wil be repaired. The projects aims that 600 young people will get their primary education during three years.

iati-activity.title: Humanitarian aid to Somalia through Finnish Church Aid
iati-activity.description: Relief aid to Somalia

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Int.Solidary Foundation)
iati-activity.description: Enhancing Women_s Participation in Decision Making. The purpose of the project is that community demand has increased for women to participate in decision-making at district level_ middle management and administrative level and community committees in Togdheer Region.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Int.Solidary Foundation)
iati-activity.description: Salt production as livelihood and gender project. Women in Berbera_ Buroa and Hargeisa towns have improved opportunities for a decent income from their businesses and skills provided_ planning phase

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Pelastakaa lapset)
iati-activity.description: Hiran_ Somalia_ Inclusive education for children. Improve the rights to quality education for children affected by armed conflict in Hiran region in Somalia by providing quality primary education in safe_ participatory learning environments

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Integrated project against HIV/AIDS
iati-activity.description: HIV/AIDS in Somalia must be added to a national issue of concern. Somali people in exile in Ethiopia and in Kenya are under a large risque. Enhanced knowledge and skills towards HIV/AIDS and adopting the right practice and attitude will help the Somali people to protect themselves and others.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / By Teaching a Girl You Teach the Whole Family
iati-activity.description: The aim of the project is to enhance writing and reading skills of the ten to fifteen years old by organising ervey day schooling and organise twise a week study groups to the women aged below 20 years. The purpose is to sustain the basic education in the Somalian circumstances where state schooling system doesn_t exist. The purpose is to give children and younsters possibilities to continue the studies and possibilities to find a job. In addition the aim is to educate the teachers and give environmental and peace education.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Maygaagle_s nomad life improvement
iati-activity.description: Litteracy and school enrollment will be improved through repairing and equipping school premises. Access to clean water for the 400 inhabitants of the village and their cattle wil be improved by constructing wells.
iati-activity.sector: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Somali Youth in Defence of Peace
iati-activity.description: Organize a series of competitions of poems for peace_ locally and nationally in Somaliland. The winning peoms will be published in literature and recorded format. The project will integrate the text creation of traditional oral tradition and technology of modern popular culture.

iati-activity.title: Project for Training Health Professionals in Northern-Somalia
iati-activity.description: The project will support health sector development in Northern Somalia by strengthening the human resource base in region's public and private health sectors.

iati-activity.title: Frame Agreement with NGO (Finnish Red Cross)
iati-activity.description: Health programme. To support the Somali Red Crescent Society to implement its health programming to improve the health status of vulnerable people in Somalia with special attention to the health of mothers and children and to strengthen the insitutional capacity of the society.

iati-activity.title: Frame Agreement with NGO (Finn Church Aid)
iati-activity.description: Religious and Traditional Peace Leaders Initiative . The overall objective is to significantly reduce the levels of active conflict in Somali regions of Somaliland, Puntland and if possible in South-Central parts of Somalia together with facilitating accelerated efforts toward reconstruction.
iati-activity.sector: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Operation theatre initiative incorporated to HIV/AIDS elimination
iati-activity.description: Decrease the mortality rate of mothers and children and improvement of the statuys of women in Afgoye district, Lower Shabelle through improving the maternity and child health care, establishing and equipping an operation theatre, retraining the staff and hiring a gynaecologist and and surgery specialist.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Khat Awareness and Youth Employment
iati-activity.description: Khat drug abuse is very frequent among young and adult population in Puntland, Somalia; it is also one catalyst in conflicts. Awareness of the harms of this drug is low even among educated persons. Improvement of the livelihood of the young, increased awareness, integration of the youth in common activities and sports will affect also the need of khat.

iati-activity.title: Waaberi Primary School Project for 180 pupils
iati-activity.description: A primary school for 180 pupils will be supported. The curriculum will be drawn, teaching materials bought and teachers hired. The traditional leaders, clan chiefs, and religious authorities as well as the government of Somalia will be integrated in the planning and activites of the school.
iati-activity.participating-org: Finnish NGO, Somali reconstruction and social develop

iati-activity.title: Support to Somalia Common Humanitarian Fund (CHF)
iati-activity.description: Support to the Common Humanitarian Fund (CHF) of Somalia, administered by OCHA.
iati-activity.participating-org: United Nations Office of Co-ordination of Humanitarian Affairs (UNOCHA)

iati-activity.title: Humanitarian Assistance to Somalia throughIFRC
iati-activity.description: Support to the IFRC's humanitarian assistance programmes in Somalia
iati-activity.participating-org: International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC)

iati-activity.title: Supporting health center activities in Somalia
iati-activity.description: To improve the basic health situation in Af-Madow, Southern Somalia through repairing the health care centre, training and recruiting health care personnel, and spreading information of the deseases and sanitation.

iati-activity.title: Supporting a health care unit
iati-activity.description: The Project is continuation of previous cooperation in the Central area of Somalia, Galgaduud, in the districts of Dusamareb, Gadoon, Mareerguud and Guriel. The health situation of the population of 400 to 600 thousands will be improved through supporting a health care unit.
iati-activity.participating-org: Finnish NGO, Sahed Yhdistys ry., SAH

iati-activity.title: MIDA Health Northern Somalia
iati-activity.description: Aiming at contributing to the development of a well-functioning health system and well-performing health workforce in Northern Somalia this three year project proposes a mechanism to facilitate the temporary assignments in Northern Somalia for up to 50 Somali and Finnish health professionals. Complementary liaison, promotion and information activities will inform policy- and decision-makers and the public at large about the benefits of outward circular migration and the positive role of Somali diaspora in Finland, and will encourage partnerships between various Finnish and Somali health care institutions and associations. It is expected that by the end of the project there will be an institutionalized model for temporary returns of qualified Finland-based Somali diaspora health professionals.

iati-activity.title: Sustainable and Secure Rural Water Services in Northwest Somalia
iati-activity.description: To enable rural communities in Somaliland, particularly women and children, to develop secure, predictable coping mechanisms in the face of water scarcity recurrent droughts exacerbated by climate change.
iati-activity.sector: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Pelastakaa lapset)
iati-activity.description:
The project aims to increase the capacity of duty bearers to prevent, and respond to abuse, neglect, exploitation and violence affecting children in Somaliland and Puntland in project target areas and develop community-based child protection structures in project target areas The project aims to increase the capacity of duty bearers to prevent, and respond to abuse, neglect, exploitation and violence affecting children in Somaliland and Puntland in project target areas. and develop community-based child protection structures in project target areas
The project aims to increase the capacity of duty bearers to prevent, and respond to abuse, neglect, exploitation and violence affecting children in Somaliland and Puntland in project target areas. and develop community-based child protection structures in project target areas

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Pelastakaa lapset)
iati-activity.description: The project aims to increase childrenâs influence on decisions affecting their lives in project target areas and to establish active civil society in support of child rights in target areas.

iati-activity.title: NASIB - capacity building
iati-activity.description: To evaluate the on-going NABIB-project and to normalize the activities and returning to Mogadishu if possible.

iati-activity.title: Support for the peace process in Somalia
iati-activity.description: Finland's support is directed towards supporting the implementation of UNPOS (United Nations Political Office for Somalia) strategy in Somalia, especially in relation to its outreach & reconsiliation initiatives.
iati-activity.participating-org: United Nations Political Office for Somalia (UNPOS)
iati-activity.sector: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

iati-activity.title: UNDP: Support to Somalia stabilization and peace process
iati-activity.description: Support to UNDP Somalia meeting in Finland in close collaboration with Finnish Somali diaspora. The participants will consist of Somali representatives from the region (Somalia, Horn of Africa) and the west. The Finnish diaspora will play a very important role.

iati-activity.title: HADYA - community theatre for women in Somalia
iati-activity.description: Women in South and North Somalia are trainded to be community theatre instructors in order to put forward societal problems and strengthen their consciousness and self-esteem and their role in social development.

iati-activity.title: Support through UNDPKO
iati-activity.description: Support to United Nations Department of Peacekeeping Operations (UNDPKO), UNSOA to Somalia
iati-activity.participating-org: United Nations Department of Peacekeeping Operations (UNDPKO)
